description: A bntSwDefGwUp trap signifies that the default
gateway is alive.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD BLADETYPE6-NETWORK-MIB::bntSwDefGwUp BLADETYPE6-NETWORK-MIB::ipCurCfgGwIndex i 9999 BLADETYPE6-NETWORK-MIB::ipCurCfgGwAddr a 192.0.2.1 SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysContact s EXAMPLE

description: The gateway number for which the information is related.
variables.name: BLADETYPE6-NETWORK-MIB::ipCurCfgGwIndex

description: The IP address of the default gateway.
variables.name: BLADETYPE6-NETWORK-MIB::ipCurCfgGwAddr

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: The physical location of this node (e.g., 'telephone
closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the
value is the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysLocation

description: The textual identification of the contact person for
this managed node, together with information on how
to contact this person. If no contact information is
known, the value is the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysContact

description: A bntSwDefGwDown trap signifies that the default
gateway is down.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD BLADETYPE6-NETWORK-MIB::bntSwDefGwDown BLADETYPE6-NETWORK-MIB::ipCurCfgGwIndex i 9999 BLADETYPE6-NETWORK-MIB::ipCurCfgGwAddr a 192.0.2.1 SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysContact s EXAMPLE

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: The physical location of this node (e.g., 'telephone
closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the
value is the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysLocation

description: The textual identification of the contact person for
this managed node, together with information on how
to contact this person. If no contact information is
known, the value is the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysContact

description: A bntSFPRemoved trap signifies that a SFP is removed.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD BLADETYPE6-NETWORK-MIB::bntSFPRemoved BLADETYPE6-NETWORK-MIB::bntSwTrapDisplayString s EXAMPLE IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysContact s EXAMPLE

description: Temporary string object used to store information being sent
in an BNT Switch trap.
variables.name: BLADETYPE6-NETWORK-MIB::bntSwTrapDisplayString

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: The physical location of this node (e.g., 'telephone
closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the
value is the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysLocation

description: The textual identification of the contact person for
this managed node, together with information on how
to contact this person. If no contact information is
known, the value is the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysContact
